results.title: La Garonne
results.brief_description: One of a series of teaching films with commentary in simple french. Sketches the outlines of france and the course of the river with its tributaries, before presenting its source in the Pyrenees whose peaks we see as we descend close to the torrent through gorges and ravines.

results.title: La Femme Aux Bottes Rouges = the Woman with Red Boots
results.creator_credit: Juan Bunuel, Raymond Vogel and Jordan Bojillon
results.brief_description:
Francoise Leroy, a young and unknown writer, has supernatural gifts. She becomes acquainted with Perou, an old millionaire who loathes artists. Perou is smitten by the young woman whom he saw naked once. He starts stalking her and discovers she lives with Richard, a painter, but that she is secretely attracted to Marc, her publisher, to whom she sends letters. Perou intercepts these letters and sends replies to Francoise, pretending to be Marc. Then, he proceeds to help Marc, who is married, to kill his wife. Finally, he invites the young woman and her two rival lovers to spend time at his house. There, the final show down takes place between an old man who has already destroyed several artists’ lives and the young woman with strange powers.

Credits: Producers, Jordan Bojillon, Raymond Vogel ; director, Juan Bunuel ; writers, Jean-Claude Carriere, Juan Bunuel, Pierre-Jean Maintigneux, Clem Wood ; photography, Leopold Villasenor.
Cast: Catherine Deneuve, Fernando Rey, Jacques Weber, Adalberto-Maria Merli, Jose Sacristan, Emma Cohen, Laura Betti.

results.title: La Cousine Bette
results.brief_description:
Cousine Bette is fast approaching 40 and hoping to marry a young man, Wenceslas, 20 years her senior, whose studies she is supporting financially. Upon learning that her trust and hopes have been betrayed and that Wenceslas is about to marry Hortense, Bette’s young niece, the ‘poor cousin’ sets up a plot to destroy her entire family by exploiting their weaknesses.

Credits: Director, Yves-Andre Hubert ; writers, Jean-Louis Bory ‘ photography, Rene Mathelin ; music, Dominique Paladilhe.
Cast: Alice Sapritch, Daniele Lebrun, Jean Sobieski, Elina Labourdette, Jacques Castelot, Claudine Coster, Jacques Monod.

results.title: La Chambre
results.brief_description:
Pierre is happily married to Eve and lives a comfortable existence. One day, as he is scheduled for a business trip, Eve finds him prostrate in the bathroom. Little by little, Pierre seems to lose contact with reality, refusing to leave his room and conducting dialogues with an other woman.

Credits: Director, Michel Mitrani ; writers, Gerard Jarlot, Michel Mitrani ; photography, Ghislain Cloquet.
Cast: Michel Auclair, Mireille Perey, Jean-Roger Caussimon, Marc Heyrand, Andree Tainsy.

results.title: La Chaise Vide = the Empty Chair
results.brief_description:
Anne is raising her child alone and works in a photo library. She is waiting for her reporter lover to return from the war in Africa and refuses any offer to start a new life with Maxime, a musician.

Credits: Director, Pierre Jallaud ; writers, Pierre Jallaud, Maxime Le Forestier ; photography, Georges Barsky ; music, Maxime Le Forestier.
Cast: Martine Chevalier, Daniel Quenaud, Maxime Le Forestier, Cyril Stockman, Evane Hanska.

results.title: L.A.: as suggested by the art of Edward Ruscha
results.creator_credit: Gary Conklin and Gary Conklin Films
results.brief_description: Edward Ruscha’s paintings, drawings and photographs are the point of departure for this impressionistic study of Los Angeles’ buildings, apartment houses, palm trees, swimming pools, cars and signs, enhanced by the city’s unique winter light. Features music by Gershwin, Django Reinhardt, Eric Satie, Czerny, M. Lecudna. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: L'Orange
results.brief_description: Filmed on location at Fitzroy High School by Year 9 students this short film parodies French arthouse cinema through its photography, movement and sound. Whimsical and somewhat amusing. Voiceover in French - no subtitles. Original soundtrack by Tom Noonan.

results.title: L'homme Au Chapeau Rond
results.brief_description:
When his wife Nathalie dies, Nicolas, a former judge, hits the bottle. His mood becomes even grimmer when he learns that his daughter Lisa is in fact the result of Nathalie’s affair with Michel. One night, Nicolas approaches Michel with his revelations and Michel promises to look after the child. But soon after the child is despatched to the country and the two men resume their favorite game: womanising.

Credits: Director, Pierre Billon ; writers, Charles Spaak, Pierre Brive ; photography, Nicolas Toporkoff ; music, Maurice Thiriet ; art direction, Georges Wakhevitch.
Cast: Raimu, Aime Clariond, Lucy Valnor, Gisele Casadessus, Louis Seigner, Jane Marken, Micheline Boudet, France Delahalle.

results.title: L'enfant Invisible = the Invisible Child
results.brief_description:
A young boy is enjoying a pleasant holiday in a beautiful villa by the sea. One day, he meets a young transparent girl, who only he can see and starts playing with her.

Credits: Director: Andre Lindon ; writer, Andre Lindon ; music, Ronan Girre, Jean-Jacques Rulhmann ; animators, Andre Lindon, Muriel Petit, Mickael Volaris.

results.title: L'Ecole Buissonniere = I Have a New Master
results.creator_credit: Jean-Paul Le Chanois, Pierre Laurent and Pierre Corti
results.brief_description:
At the end of WWI, Pascal Laurent, a young teacher, is sent to replace a retiring teacher in a small village of Provence. Pascal is keen on replacing the old authoritarian method of education with a new pedagogy. The children are soon won over, but Pascal’s unorthodox methods meet with the resistance from both his superiors and his students’ parents.

Credits: Producer, Pierre Corti, Pierre Laurent ; director, Jean-Paul Le Chanois ; writer, Jean-Paul Le Chanois ; photography, Marc Fossard, Maurice Pecqueux, Andre Dumaitre ; music, Joseph Kosma.
Cast: Bernard Blier, Juliette Faber, Edouard Delmont, Marcel Maupi, Edmond Ardisson, Henri Poupon, Gaston Modot, Lucien Callamand.
